ownedComment.body: Restriction on capability or operations allowed. (ISO20022)

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of an account.

Entry means Posting to an account that results in an increase or decrease to a balance. (ISO20022)
An entry posted/booked in the account.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

to do: definitie opzoeken
A statement of account is a detailed report of the contents of an account. (AccountingTool)

A unit of an organisation that does not have legal standing outside the organisation.
A logical element or segment of a company (such as accounting, production, marketing) representing a specific business function, and a definite place on the organizational chart, under the domain of a manager. Also called department, division, or a functional area. (Business Dictionary)
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/business-unit.html

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
The position of account at the certain point of time.
The counted state (e.g., the amount of money, the value, the number) of something - It is the sum of entries - It is the derived attribute - It is an information object

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.
Instruction to pay an amount of money to an ultimate beneficiary, on behalf of an originator. (ISO20022)
Transfer of money between two parties and/or accounts

An act, initiated by the payer or payee, of placing, transferring or withdrawing funds, irrespective of any underlying obligations between the payer and payee (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from PSD)

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
A party role which is involved in the payment transaction.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.
A request to do something.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W

Entry means Posting to an account that results in an increase or decrease to a balance. (ISO20022)
An entry posted/booked in the account.
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
Specified a document that is assigned to a specific transaction.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.

A course of action must be followed to execute the procedure.
Worksteps as Behaviour Qualifier Type: The main worksteps to be followed in the execution of the procedure

An exposed function (an externalized functionality) that is able to deliver a certain value/benefit (a proposed definition adapted from Archimate).
A unit of functionality that a system exposes to its environment, while hiding internal operations, which provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise).
Comment:
A Service is something that is done by an actor for the benefit of an actor in the environment.
A system is the broad sense of the word. Means Business Service, Application Service, Technology Service, "huppeldepup" Service
Characteristics of a service:
A system (The Service Domain) Functionality is exposed (Action Term) It provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise)
Exposing functionality means that the internals of realizing the service is hidden for the beneficiary of the Service.
In BIAN a "Service Operation" is visualized as a "Business Service" , the "System" refers to the "Service Domain"
The name of a Service Operation is composed of an "Action Term" + "Subject Matter" which is the "Control Record" or the "Behaviour Qualifier".
Service is the intangible equivalent of a good. (ISO20022).
A type of economic activity that is intangible, is not stored and does not result in ownership; a service is consumed at the point of sale (FIBO & Business Dictionary)

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

A step-by-step sequence of activities or course of action to perform a supporting office activity within the enterprise.
A procedure is a series of steps, taken together, to achieve a desired result.
Procedure as Generic Artifact: The performance of a supporting office activity within the enterprise (not product/service fulfillment specific)
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of an agreement.
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
A set of rules (e.g., regulation, policy, law, guideline, principle, standard) to guide, direct or operate a subject matter.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)

Condition is a premise upon which the fulfillment of an agreement depends
Condition is applied to an instance of an agreement.
Jurisdiction that will be assigned in case of legal dispute.
Document that will be assigned to the agreement.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
Explanation or interpretation of a rule for an agreement
The revelation of information relevant to an agreement or potential agreement.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A characteristic of agreement which refers to its related agreements.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

Condition is a premise upon which the fulfillment of an agreement depends
General and special arrangements, provisions, requirements, rules, specifications, and standards that form an integral part of an agreement or contract.

A request to do something.
A detailed characteristic of a product expressed in offered services and the terms and conditions applicable to the delivery of the services.

- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
Human entity, as distinguished from a corporate entity (which is sometimes referred to as an 'artificial person'). ISO20022

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
Number, physical or virtual address, used for communication.
A place to locate a party.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
structure/make-up of an organizational entity

A written authorization that transfers specific rights from a party to another party.
Document that transfers specific rights from a party to another party. ISO20022
A set of information giving a description of a person or organization.
An agreement that outlines the terms and conditions of the relationship between the two or more parties. An agreement has arrangements which are the cause of the relationship.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W

A certification issued for a party.
An issued document to certify a party.
A session for managing dialogues with a customer in an active contact.

The operation of a system -- typically an automated system -- for a bounded period of time.
Semi-permanent container of state for an information exchange with a system.
Time-bounded, temporal unit of context and continuity, identifying a unit of work.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Set of integrated applications that provides centralised services such as clearing, netting, reconciliation, trading and/or settlement. (ISO20022)
An (structured) interaction between a customer and a financial institution.
A specific role of a specific Party involved in the customer contact.
A record of servicing events.

An evaluation whether a party or system is what it claims to be.
A security mechanism for verifying: 1) the identity of an individual or other entity (including verification by means of a computer or computer application); and 2) the level of authority of that person or entity (i.e. the ability of that person or entity to perform specific tasks or activities). (ECB)
Action of a customer using the channel in an active contact.
A session involving contact between a customer and a financial institution.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Posting a contact dialogue to the log
The operation of a Point of Service for a bounded period of time. A servicing session.
An item created to serve a particular need, such as a credit card, a smart phone, an electronic signature, an electronic key, etc.
A system for managing contact between a customer and a financial institution from beginning till finish.

A kind of action.
Functions as Behaviour Qualifier: The collection of operational services/functions offered by the operational facility.
Point at which a service is offered and/or fulfilled.
A record of channel activities.
A record of contact dialogue log entries.
Event which is the result of fulfilling a servicing arrangement.
A decision to identify the most suitable servicing position to route the contact
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
A report which is the result of the internal analysis of credit.
An internal analysis for credit rating focusing on the internal product/service activities of customer.
Rating of the Customer or Customer Relationship for value, credit, risk and etc.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.
An organization which gives a credit rating to the customer.
Measurement as Generic Artifact: A mechanism to track and report on the state or dynamic property of some item or activity.
An event/message to notify issues as alerts against a credit rating assessment.
the rating/certification derived as result of an applied test assessment of an entity using specific testing criteria

A unique and specific set of information containing the content for communications.
The term Report is mostly used as communication about a particular subject matter, often in the form of an official document, after thorough investigation or consideration by an appointed person or body.
A document containing information organized in a narrative, graphic, or tabular form, prepared on ad hoc, periodic, recurring, regular, or as required basis. Reports may refer to specific periods, events, occurrences, or subjects, and may be communicated or presented in oral or written form. (Business Dictionary)

Def.1 The insights derived from an analysis applied to an entity using specific models/evaluation methods
Def.2 A detailed examination of anything complex

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

A model representing the customer behaviour.
Model is used to facilitate learning what is known of customer behaviour.
A report which is the result of the credit rating by an external agency.
An external service for credit rating.
An evaluation of the credit rating for a customer.
Something that happens, has happened, can happen or is planned to happen.
A report of the customer's (internal) product/service activities.
The application of a measurement to assess the overall credibility of a customer.
An item created to serve a particular need, such as a credit card, a smart phone, an electronic signature, an electronic key, etc.
The allocation of a Device to a ProductSalesAgreement

The usage of a device
e.g. the issuance of a cheque from a chequebook, the logon to an e-banking application, the usage of a digipass
The allocation of a device to a party
A taxonomical classification of device, according to its characteristics as an item.
Options for configuring a device.
Arrangement on the provision and use of product instruments.
An agreement between a bank and its customer for a sold product.

A device (payment instrument) that can be used by its holder to pay for goods and services or to withdraw money. (The dictionary of ECB)
Electronic money product that provides the cardholder with a portable and specialised computer device that typically contains a microprocessor. (ISO20022)
Payment Card means a category of payment instrument that enables the payer to initiate a debit or credit card transaction. (PSD)
Type of card, e.g., credit card. (ISO20022)
Number embossed on a card that links the card to the account owner and account servicer (sometimes called personal account number or PAN). (ISO20022)
Year and month the card is available for use. (ISO20022)
Year and month the card expires. (ISO20022)
Security code written on the card, sometimes called card security code (CSC). (ISO20022)
The bank identification number uniquely identifies the institution issuing the card. The BIN is key in the process of matching transactions to the issuer of the charge card.
A bank account upon which the financial position of card payment arrangements are managed.
An item created to serve a particular need, such as a credit card, a smart phone, an electronic signature, an electronic key, etc.

Reference to the device type of the device
A device has the characteristics of the device type it belongs to possibly specified e.g. a device of the type "cheque book" will have cheques. The device specifies how many and what the number range is. e.g. an electronic banking app consists of software modules, the device specifies what version

Property of a device relevant for its use.
A device has the characteristics of the device type it belongs to,possibly specified e.g. . a device of the type "cheque book" will have cheques. The device specifies how many and what the number range is. e.g. an electronic banking app consists of software modules, the device specifies what version

An element of the device that can be used independently and is individually identified
e.g. a cheque in a chequebook

The life cycle stage of a device
e.g. active, defect
Task to determine the final resolution of the collections process - either the payments are received account is recovered or it is passed to recovery processing.
Details of the resolution decision.
Work documentation, forms and schedules produced and referenced during the task.

The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
A characteristic of account which refers to the LifecycleStatus of account like opened, closed, blocked, etc.
The identifier of account like Account Number.
A characteristic of account which refers to LifecycleDate of account (e.g., ClosingDate, OpeningDate, LiveDate, etc.)
Specifies the category of account like payment account, loan account, cash account, securities account, etc.

The state of the obligations managed on the account, the result of all entries on the account.
Numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account at a specific point in time. (ISO20022)
Banking: Amount available in an account for withdrawal or use. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
Bookkeeping: Difference between the debit and credit sides of an account. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
A detailed explanation or commentary of account.
A record of events/entries.
Posting events to the log.
structure/make-up of an organizational entity

An event related to the behaviour performed by an actor.
Comment: An actor can be a party or a machine An action Includes various types of requests, orders and financial transactions. Includes responses where appropriate. An action is an event which means that the concept describes the result of acting.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
Something that happens, has happened, can happen or is planned to happen.
Instruction to execute a payment from a payer to a payee
A request to do something.
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.
Transfer of money between two parties and/or accounts
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.

A contract that gives rise to a financial asset of one entity and a financial liability or equity instrument of another entity. (IFRS) https://www.iasplus.com/en/standards/ias/ias32#:~:text=Key%20definitions%20%5BIAS%2032.11%5D,equity%20instrument%20of%20another%20entity
Financial instruments are financial contracts of different nature made between institutional units. These comprise the full range of financial claims and liabilities between institutional units, including contingent liabilities like guarantees, commitments, etc. (ISO 10962)
a distinctive attribute or aspect of something.

An agreement that authorises a party (holding party) to act on behalf of a principal party.
Authorisation given by an issuing party to a holder party to act on the issuer's behalf. (ISO20022)
Written authorization and/or command by a person, group, or organization (the 'mandator') to another (the 'mandatary') to take a certain course of action. (Business Dictionary)

The operation of a system -- typically an automated system -- for a bounded period of time.
Semi-permanent container of state for an information exchange with a system.
Time-bounded, temporal unit of context and continuity, identifying a unit of work.
Event related to a specific Customer or Customer Relationship.
the rating/certification derived as result of an applied test assessment of an entity using specific testing criteria
Set of integrated applications that provides centralised services such as clearing, netting, reconciliation, trading and/or settlement. (ISO20022)

A unique and specific set of information containing the content for communications.
The term Report is mostly used as communication about a particular subject matter, often in the form of an official document, after thorough investigation or consideration by an appointed person or body.
A document containing information organized in a narrative, graphic, or tabular form, prepared on ad hoc, periodic, recurring, regular, or as required basis. Reports may refer to specific periods, events, occurrences, or subjects, and may be communicated or presented in oral or written form. (Business Dictionary)

Def.1 The insights derived from an analysis applied to an entity using specific models/evaluation methods
Def.2 A detailed examination of anything complex

A specific Relationship (= an instance of a Relationship Class) between a specific party acting as the Bank and one or more other specific involved Parties. A Relationship is a logical unit of collaboration between two or more involved Parties.

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
A simplified representation of reality.
Measurement as Generic Artifact: A mechanism to track and report on the state or dynamic property of some item or activity.
An agreement established among the card holder and the card issuer to use the payment card for payment
An arrangement defining the applicable features for a loan account agreement.

An arrangement defining the applicable features for a savings account agreement.
The arrangement type is one of those possible/mandatory for the sale of a savings account product. The actual arrangements are a selection of those offered under the savings account product.
An agreement with subject matter banking services.

A course of action must be followed to execute the procedure.
Worksteps as Behaviour Qualifier Type: The main worksteps to be followed in the execution of the procedure

A step-by-step sequence of activities or course of action to perform a supporting office activity within the enterprise.
A procedure is a series of steps, taken together, to achieve a desired result.
Procedure as Generic Artifact: The performance of a supporting office activity within the enterprise (not product/service fulfillment specific)
A Classification value that distinguishes between the type of process undertaken within Procedure
Request to process something (most refers to Asset Type)
Timetable to process something (most refers to the Asset Type)
The status of Procedure

A payment transaction initiated by a payment card.
'Card-based payment transaction means a service based on a payment card scheme's infrastructure and business rules to make a payment transaction by means of any card, telecommunication, digital or IT device or software if this results in a debit or a credit card transaction. Card-based payment transactions exclude transactions based on other kinds of payment services. (PSD)
Amount added to the total price of the transaction and received in cash by the customer. (ISO20022)
Place where the merchant actually performed the transaction. (ISO20022)
Specifies the direction of a payment. (ISO20022)
Identifies the type of the communication channels used by the cardholder to the acceptor system. (ISO20022)
Describes the Point of Interaction through which the payment by card was initiated. (ISO20022)
Local date and time of the transaction assigned by the POI (Point Of Interaction). (ISO20022)
Indicates the environment of the transaction like Merchant, Private, Public, Branch.
Country of the merchant where the transaction took place. (ISO20022)
Network used for handling the card payment transaction.

An act, initiated by the payer or payee, of placing, transferring or withdrawing funds, irrespective of any underlying obligations between the payer and payee (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from PSD)
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to a Payment Transaction.
The payment mechanism the bank decides to use in the transaction to execute a payment instruction
Task to determine the appropriate collections process to follow - based on status/history of the account - e.g. can be an internal collections function or an external agency.
Details of the assignment decision.
Work documentation, forms and schedules produced and referenced during the task.

A collection agency is a company used by lenders, or creditors, to recover funds that are past due, or from accounts that are in default. (Investopedia)
Additional party appointed to collect payment or securities on behalf of the issuer. (ISO20022)
An agreement which specifies the terms and conditions governing the use of the collection agency.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Task to manage payments made against a card account in collections. Note the payment is processed by the card facility - here the collections process is amended.
An evaluation of the credit rating for a customer.
An (structured) interaction between a customer and a financial institution.
The start and end date times for the contact
The schedule of past and planned customer contacts
The interpreted result of the contact (e.g. completed, customer terminated, timed-out)
The reason and or purpose for the contact (e.g. review, issue, product sales, advice, customer enquiry)
Indicates whether this is an inbound or outbound contact (inbound is customer initiated, outbound is servicing resource initiated).
Task to negotiate repayment terms with the customer - which may include waiving delinquency charges as motivation.
The payment terms renegotiation decision, includes renegotiated terms and repayment schedule.
Work documentation, forms and schedules produced and referenced during the task.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)
Date on which the agreement was signed by all parties. (ISO20022)

Specifies the category of agreement. Agreement type is very often referred to product. But, the term product does not cover all kinds of agreements. An Agreement can be subtyped from the perspective of various aspects of interest. One can classify the agreement from the perspective of format type (e.g., verbal agreement, written agreement). Other one can classify agreement based on duration like short-term agreement or long-term agreement.
Period during which the agreement is valid
LifecycleStatus of agreement (e.g., potential, offered, confirmed, completed, signed, terminated)
The identifier of agreement like Agreement Number, Contract Number, Contract Registration Number, etc.

A characteristic of agreement which refers to 1) LifecycleDate of agreement (e.g., SignedDate, TerminatedDate, FulfilledDate) OR 2) ArrangedDate of agreement (e.g., StartingDate, EndingDate, ValidityPeriod, EffectiveDate).

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party. (ISO20022)
Specifies the type of party in different business contexts. (ISO20022)
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.

A course of action must be followed to execute the procedure.
Worksteps as Behaviour Qualifier Type: The main worksteps to be followed in the execution of the procedure

An exposed function (an externalized functionality) that is able to deliver a certain value/benefit (a proposed definition adapted from Archimate).
A unit of functionality that a system exposes to its environment, while hiding internal operations, which provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise).
Comment:
A Service is something that is done by an actor for the benefit of an actor in the environment.
A system is the broad sense of the word. Means Business Service, Application Service, Technology Service, "huppeldepup" Service
Characteristics of a service:
A system (The Service Domain) Functionality is exposed (Action Term) It provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise)
Exposing functionality means that the internals of realizing the service is hidden for the beneficiary of the Service.
In BIAN a "Service Operation" is visualized as a "Business Service" , the "System" refers to the "Service Domain"
The name of a Service Operation is composed of an "Action Term" + "Subject Matter" which is the "Control Record" or the "Behaviour Qualifier".
Service is the intangible equivalent of a good. (ISO20022).
A type of economic activity that is intangible, is not stored and does not result in ownership; a service is consumed at the point of sale (FIBO & Business Dictionary)

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

A step-by-step sequence of activities or course of action to perform a supporting office activity within the enterprise.
A procedure is a series of steps, taken together, to achieve a desired result.
Procedure as Generic Artifact: The performance of a supporting office activity within the enterprise (not product/service fulfillment specific)
The act of assignment or the act of allocating.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)

An object classified as something of value. It is some tangible or intangible thing that the bank has ownership and/or influence over and has one or more inherent uses or purposes that create commercial value Comment BIAN has defined the likely assets found in any bank and uses this approach to isolate the specific types of asset that are acted on by the ServiceDomains. The role or purpose of each and every ServiceDomain is to apply its specific functional pattern to instances of one type of asset. Is the tangible or intangible item that can have associated 'replacement' value/worth and purpose/use for which the bank has ownership or some level of control. It is exploited/leveraged in the execution of business through the application of some business behavior/control as effected by a ServiceDomain. Some asset types are obvious - for example a machine or building, some are intangible but easily identified such as knowhow, knowledge, relationships, reputation. Some are less obvious - most common is the 'capacity to perform' type which applies to many BIAN Service Domains. For example in the case of product fulfillment and support activities like party authentication the asset is the bank's possession of the capacity to perform these activities - the combination of the people/processes/systems to execute if you will...
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.
A request to do something.
An agreement with subject matter banking services.
A reservation of part or whole of the asset value to secure the payment of repayment expressed in a payment obligation.

Asset provided by a debtor as security for a payment or repayment of an obligation.
Financial collateral is an asset provided by a borrower to a lender.
The term collateral refers to an asset that a lender accepts as security for a loan. https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/collateral.asp
The result of a valuation of some aspect of an Asset.

An Agreement between two trading parties whereby one or more Assets are provided by a debtor as security for a payment or repayment of one or more obligations. (BIAN)
Comment: The subject matter of the agreement is "securing payment". The most important arrangements are the collateral arrangements. But in the agreement are also price arrangements, period arrangements, fulfillment arrangements etc. agreed.

An arrangement within an agreement where an Asset is provided as security for a payment or repayment of an obligation. (BIAN)
Agreement between two trading parties that contains information about their relative duties and rights regarding collateral processes. (ISO20022)

An obligation to do the payment.
Obligation for the debtor to pay the creditor an amount of cash. (ISO20022)
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A request to do something.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
An instruction to do something expressed in an amount of money.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement

An arrangement into which is promised to deliver a specific service.
Comment: Most service arrangements are instantiations of Product Services
The fulfilment of the engagements (obligations/rights) taken in an arrangement
A duty that is specified in and imposed by an agreement. (FIBO)
A contingent right conferred via an agreement. (FIBO)

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of an arrangement.
Specification of how a service arrangement can be fulfilled.
A Service Modality applicable to a Service Feature

Right or obligation linked to the involvement of a party in an agreement
Can be default, linked to an involvement type, or specifically agreed upon. This can be default obligations or entitlements, of specific arrangements
A detailed characteristic of a product expressed in offered services and the terms and conditions applicable to the delivery of the services.
A service offered as a feature of a product.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A request to do something.
A characteristic of arrangement which refers to its related arrangements.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
Something that happens, has happened, can happen or is planned to happen.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
The way in which a service can happen.

An exposed function (an externalized functionality) that is able to deliver a certain value/benefit (a proposed definition adapted from Archimate).
A unit of functionality that a system exposes to its environment, while hiding internal operations, which provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise).
Comment:
A Service is something that is done by an actor for the benefit of an actor in the environment.
A system is the broad sense of the word. Means Business Service, Application Service, Technology Service, "huppeldepup" Service
Characteristics of a service:
A system (The Service Domain) Functionality is exposed (Action Term) It provides a certain value (monetary or otherwise)
Exposing functionality means that the internals of realizing the service is hidden for the beneficiary of the Service.
In BIAN a "Service Operation" is visualized as a "Business Service" , the "System" refers to the "Service Domain"
The name of a Service Operation is composed of an "Action Term" + "Subject Matter" which is the "Control Record" or the "Behaviour Qualifier".
Service is the intangible equivalent of a good. (ISO20022).
A type of economic activity that is intangible, is not stored and does not result in ownership; a service is consumed at the point of sale (FIBO & Business Dictionary)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
The product/service profile for a specific customer or customer relationship.
Rating of the Customer or Customer Relationship for value, credit, risk and etc.

A responsibility of task (under management).
Duties are a collection of one or more responsibilities or tasks under management. (Behavior Qualifier Type)
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific Customer Relationship.
The management plan for a specific customer relationship.
An interpretation/observation on the customer's behaviour.
The action/task which is planned to develop the customer relationship.
The budget which is planned to spend for a specific customer relationship.

The course of action to realize goals (of an operational unit of an enterprise).
The management and oversight while running an operational unit of an enterprise. (Generic Artifact)

A specific Relationship (= an instance of a Relationship Class) between a specific party acting as the Bank and one or more other specific involved Parties. A Relationship is a logical unit of collaboration between two or more involved Parties.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.
An (structured) interaction between a customer and a financial institution.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Unplanned interruption to a service, a reduction in the quality of a service or an event that has not yet impacted the service to the customer where this customer relationship is impacted.

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
A transaction that changes the financial position (the status of the finances) of involved party.
A request to do something.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/documentation.html#ixzz3EQGRGC4W

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.

Entry means Posting to an account that results in an increase or decrease to a balance. (ISO20022)
An entry posted/booked in the account.
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
Specified a document that is assigned to a specific transaction.
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific Customer Relationship.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)
An agreement between a bank and its customer.
An agreement between a bank and its customer for a sold product.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
The definition of an addressable space/position both in real and virtual environments with associated uses and entitlements
Human entity, as distinguished from a corporate entity (which is sometimes referred to as an 'artificial person'). ISO20022

A relationship between two or more parties; the parties involved are specified in terms of the roles they play in the relationship.
A Party Relationship is a connection between an instance of a Party and two or more instances of associated objects in the relationship.
Number, physical or virtual address, used for communication.
A place to locate a party.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.
structure/make-up of an organizational entity

A written authorization that transfers specific rights from a party to another party.
Document that transfers specific rights from a party to another party. ISO20022
A set of information giving a description of a person or organization.
An agreement that outlines the terms and conditions of the relationship between the two or more parties. An agreement has arrangements which are the cause of the relationship.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. International trade documentations include air waybill, bill of exchange, bill of lading, certificate of inspection, certificate of insurance, certificate of origin, commercial invoice, and consular invoice.

A certification issued for a party.
An issued document to certify a party.
The involvement (role) of an instance of a party in an instance of an agreement.
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
A set of rules (e.g., regulation, policy, law, guideline, principle, standard) to guide, direct or operate a subject matter.

Something tangible that records something, such as a recording or a photograph, or a writing that can be used to furnish evidence or information (FIBO)
Definition: A physical or digital representation of something meaningful to the audience.
Comment: 1.Technical: Manuals, instructions, tutorials, procedures, specifications, etc., that accompany a piece of equipment or software, and provide guidance for its proper use and maintenance. 2.Trading: Preparation of a set of commercial and financial documents that record or support a business transaction. A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)

Condition is a premise upon which the fulfillment of an agreement depends
Condition is applied to an instance of an agreement.
Jurisdiction that will be assigned in case of legal dispute.
Document that will be assigned to the agreement.
A package of services and goods, accompanied by term and condition which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers.
Explanation or interpretation of a rule for an agreement
The revelation of information relevant to an agreement or potential agreement.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
A characteristic of agreement which refers to its related agreements.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

Condition is a premise upon which the fulfillment of an agreement depends
General and special arrangements, provisions, requirements, rules, specifications, and standards that form an integral part of an agreement or contract.
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/terms-and-conditions.html
A request to do something.
A detailed characteristic of a product expressed in offered services and the terms and conditions applicable to the delivery of the services.

An entry posted/booked in the account.

to do: definitie opzoeken
A statement of account is a detailed report of the contents of an account. (AccountingTool)

A unit of an organisation that does not have legal standing outside the organisation.
A logical element or segment of a company (such as accounting, production, marketing) representing a specific business function, and a definite place on the organizational chart, under the domain of a manager. Also called department, division, or a functional area. (Business Dictionary)
Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/business-unit.html

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
The position of account at the certain point of time.
The counted state (e.g., the amount of money, the value, the number) of something - It is the sum of entries - It is the derived attribute - It is an information object

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)

A step-by-step sequence of activities or course of action to perform a supporting office activity within the enterprise.

A Classification value that distinguishes between the type of process undertaken within Procedure
Request to process something (most refers to Asset Type)

The act of assignment or the act of allocating.
A duty that is specified in and imposed by an agreement. (FIBO)
A Feature Modality applicable to a Product Feature
An arrangement defining the applicable features for a Corporate Deposit Agreement.
A detailed characteristic of a product expressed in offered services and the terms and conditions applicable to the delivery of the services.
The way in which a feature can happen. Feature can be a Service or Condition
A brief description of the characteristics of something or someone. (Business Dictionary)

The course of action to realize goals (of an operational unit of an enterprise).
The management and oversight while running an operational unit of an enterprise. (Generic Artifact)

A method for doing or achieving something, usually involving a series of actions or stages, or something you have arranged to do. (Cambridge Dictionary)
A plan is a set of intended actions, through which one intends to achieve a goal.
"Course of action" is a synonym for Plan.

A course of action must be followed to execute the procedure.
Worksteps as Behaviour Qualifier Type: The main worksteps to be followed in the execution of the procedure
Consolidate details about the outstanding debt and associated collateral. Ensure assets are properly booked.
Assess status of the title to collateral items and obtain current valuation
Undertake liquidation of collateral to recover losses
Revise the status of the account and review collections approach based on interim liquidations
Consider factoring all or part of the residual debt

Asset provided by a debtor as security for a payment or repayment of an obligation.
Financial collateral is an asset provided by a borrower to a lender.
The term collateral refers to an asset that a lender accepts as security for a loan. https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/collateral.asp
A description of procedure which is defined to handles the liquidation of assets

An Agreement between two trading parties whereby one or more Assets are provided by a debtor as security for a payment or repayment of one or more obligations. (BIAN)
Comment: The subject matter of the agreement is "securing payment". The most important arrangements are the collateral arrangements. But in the agreement are also price arrangements, period arrangements, fulfillment arrangements etc. agreed.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of a Collateral Agreement.
External identifier assigned by a collateral registration authority to refer to the registration of the collateral agreement.
A specific role of a specific Party in the specific relationship.

An arrangement within an agreement where an Asset is provided as security for a payment or repayment of an obligation. (BIAN)
Agreement between two trading parties that contains information about their relative duties and rights regarding collateral processes. (ISO20022)
Date when the asset was provided as collateral
Classification of the collateral according to a collateral mechanism classification hierarchy. Examples: mortgage, blocked deposit, a blocked securities portfolio, pawn, etc.
A Value amount that is pledged to secure the payments or repayments.

A party represents an autonomous entity in which a bank has a business interest. It has a legal definition and identity. A party is a Person, Organization, (a proposed definition for BIAN BOM adapted from BIAN Party Working Group)
- Entity involved in an activity. (ISO20022)
Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party. (ISO20022)
Specifies the type of party in different business contexts. (ISO20022)

An object classified as something of value. It is some tangible or intangible thing that the bank has ownership and/or influence over and has one or more inherent uses or purposes that create commercial value Comment BIAN has defined the likely assets found in any bank and uses this approach to isolate the specific types of asset that are acted on by the ServiceDomains. The role or purpose of each and every ServiceDomain is to apply its specific functional pattern to instances of one type of asset. Is the tangible or intangible item that can have associated 'replacement' value/worth and purpose/use for which the bank has ownership or some level of control. It is exploited/leveraged in the execution of business through the application of some business behavior/control as effected by a ServiceDomain. Some asset types are obvious - for example a machine or building, some are intangible but easily identified such as knowhow, knowledge, relationships, reputation. Some are less obvious - most common is the 'capacity to perform' type which applies to many BIAN Service Domains. For example in the case of product fulfillment and support activities like party authentication the asset is the bank's possession of the capacity to perform these activities - the combination of the people/processes/systems to execute if you will...
Describing elements expressing valuation of the object classified as something that has value.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of an Asset.
classification of an asset according to a specific Asset classification hierarchy

A tangible or intangible thing that exist in reality.
examples: a specific house, a specific golden ring, a patent, a brand, etc.

A functional Classification Hierarchy that distinguishes between objects of value according to some criteria. Comment: BIAN Has developed a classification hierarchy, but also other authorities have defined classification hierarchies.

The selling of collateral asset to pay off debts.
Liquidation in finance and economics is the process of bringing a business to an end and distributing its assets to claimants. Liquidation is the selling of assets to raise cash, usually to pay off debts.
A workstep of Collateral Asset Liquidation Procedure Workstep.

A planned or performed action in the context of concluding or fulfilling an agreement.
Act to do something.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of a transaction.

The Date that the transaction has occurred or is planned to occur. A characteristic of transaction which refers to the LifecycleDate of transaction (e.g., initiated date, executed date, fulfillment date).
Specifies the category of Transaction like payment transaction, accounting transaction, financial Transaction, banking transaction, etc.
A detailed explanation or commentary of transaction.
A characteristic of transaction which refers to the LifecycleStatus of transaction (e.g., initiated, executed, confirmed, cancelled, etc.)
The name of transaction.

A specific relationship between a specific Bank (= party acting as a supplier of banking services) and one or more other involved parties acting as (potential) consumers of banking services as agreed in one or more banking product or service offerings and/or agreements.
An agreement between a bank and its customer.
An agreed commitment to perform actions that meet obligations under an agreement
A status which refers to the LifecycleStatus of arrangement (e.g., requested, proposed, offered, accepted, cancelled, terminated, fulfilled, etc.);
A request to do something.
An identifier that allows to uniquely refer to an instance of an Instruction.

Classification Value classifying the instruction according to the "type of action" to be applied to a subject matter.
examples: payment instruction, withdrawal instruction, blocking instruction, accounting instruction, sending instruction, purchase instruction blocked deposit, a blocked securities portfolio, pawn, etc.

A formal or informal common understanding between two or more (legal competent) parties concerning one or more subject matters expressed in a set of arrangements, terms and conditions. (adapted from Legal System and FIBO)
Date on which the agreement was signed by all parties. (ISO20022)

Specifies the category of agreement. Agreement type is very often referred to product. But, the term product does not cover all kinds of agreements. An Agreement can be subtyped from the perspective of various aspects of interest. One can classify the agreement from the perspective of format type (e.g., verbal agreement, written agreement). Other one can classify agreement based on duration like short-term agreement or long-term agreement.
Period during which the agreement is valid
LifecycleStatus of agreement (e.g., potential, offered, confirmed, completed, signed, terminated)
The identifier of agreement like Agreement Number, Contract Number, Contract Registration Number, etc.

A characteristic of agreement which refers to 1) LifecycleDate of agreement (e.g., SignedDate, TerminatedDate, FulfilledDate) OR 2) ArrangedDate of agreement (e.g., StartingDate, EndingDate, ValidityPeriod, EffectiveDate).

Definition: A (Debt) Agreement into which is arranged that a party (lender) is giving money or financial instruments to another party (borrower) in exchange for future repayment of the loan value or principal amount, along with interest or finance charges.
Comment: A loan may be for a specific, one-time amount, or it can be available as an open-ended line of credit up to a specified limit, or any other variation. A classification of any agreement that provides funds to an entity in return for a promise from the entity to repay a lender or investor in accordance with terms and conditions of a contract.
Term and condition to govern the use of loan product and the loan agreement in general.
Amount of money promised to be borrowed.
An agreement between a bank and its customer for a sold product.

A measuring state on which movements in value or amounts of assets, rights and obligations are registered.
Comment: It is a bookkeeping instrument holding the amount or value of something by registering the movements in plus and min when events happen which have an impact on the position. The term "account" is usually associated to an accounting or bookkeeping concept to hold the financial or stock state of a business concept. An account will typically group the debit and credit entries for a specific aspect of the business resulting from transactions, Often accounts are represented as a T-account which is a visual aid used to depict an account. Above the top portion of the T would be the account title. On the left-side of the base of the T would be any debit amounts; on the right-side would be the credit amounts. A commonly used bookkeeping method is the double-entry method. This means that every transaction has at least 2 movements. If a customer pays 100 € in cash, there is a decrease in the amount that the customer owes to the company (the customer position is decreased) an increase in the amount that the company has in cash (the cash position is increased)
An account can be assigning to one or more ledgers. A ledger is a group of accounts for a certain purpose. If there is need for multiple ledgers because of multiple purpose, an account can perfectly well assigned to multiple ledgers. When Ledgers are in real physical books, this is not possible. When ledgers are digital, accounts can be grouped into multiple groups at the same time. This practice is very rarely taught into courses for accounting, but in digital accounting, it is common practice.
Examples: stock account of a shop, cash register, bank account, financial accounting account, customer account, supplier account, ... Bank Account BE12 1234 5678 9012: is an individual banking account Accounts Payable, is a collective account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to its suppliers. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to suppliers. This account is managed usually in a General Ledger Supplier Account X, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts to pay by the organisation to an individual supplier. The balance is the result of the financial movements related to an individual supplier. This account is managed usually in a sub-ledger. Stock Account x, is an individual account keeping the balance of the amounts in stock of a specific good. A payment service to take fund out of an account.
A characteristic of account which refers to the LifecycleStatus of account like opened, closed, blocked, etc.
The identifier of account like Account Number.
A characteristic of account which refers to LifecycleDate of account (e.g., ClosingDate, OpeningDate, LiveDate, etc.)
Specifies the category of account like payment account, loan account, cash account, securities account, etc.

The state of the obligations managed on the account, the result of all entries on the account.
Numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account at a specific point in time. (ISO20022)
Banking: Amount available in an account for withdrawal or use. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
Bookkeeping: Difference between the debit and credit sides of an account. Read more: http://www.businessdictionary.com/definition/balance.html
A detailed explanation or commentary of account.
Numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account at a specific point in time. (ISO20022) https://www.iso20022.org/standardsrepository/type/Balance
A classification of accounts based on their purpose
Time span defined by a start date and time, and an end date and time. (ISO20022)

A date is a Gregorian calendar representation in various common resolutions: year, month, week, day. (UN/CEFACT)
A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601. (ISO20022)
A name is a word or phrase that constitutes the distinctive designation of a person, place, thing or concept. (UN/CEFAT)

A date time identifies a date and time of day to various common resolutions: year, month, week, day, hour, minute, second, and fraction of second. (UN/CEFACT)
A particular point in the progression of time defined by a mandatory date and a mandatory time component, expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601. (ISO20022) Note on the time format: 1) beginning / end of calendar day 00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day 24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day 2) fractions of second in time format Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.
Text is a character string such as a finite set of characters generally in the form of words of a language. (UN/CEFACT)

A list of values which specifies the category of agreement. Agreement type is very often referred to product. But, the term product does not cover all kinds of agreements. An Agreement can be subtyped from the perspective of various aspects of interest. One can classify the agreement from the perspective of format type (e.g., verbal agreement, written agreement). Other one can classify agreement based on duration like short-term agreement or long-term agreement.
A list of values which specifies the LifecycleStatus of agreement (e.g., potential, offered, confirmed, completed, signed, terminated)
